title: On iPad, Mozilla opening a second tab

Hello from France,

When I do cmd+T to open a new tab, I write the web address and press the Enter key, Mozilla opens a second (inactive) tab and let me (aloooone!) in the first (empty) one. Furthermore, sometimes, when I do cmd+T, it opens a new tab but when, after this, I do cmd+L, it doesn’t let me write anything. I have to touch the search bar with my finger.

Regards,

Timothée Guérin

title: How do I contact Mozilla Firefox to ask if I'm able to get my profile backup off their cloud server?
content:
How do I contact Mozilla Firefox to ask if I'm able to access to my Firefox profile on their cloud server?

Windows 10 would not update so I contacted Microsoft Support and a technician spent two days trying to various methods to get the updates installed on my computer. After several failed attempts it was determined a Windows "reset" was needed. The reset stated it would uninstall apps but save user data. However, it appears the reset uninstalled and wiped my profile off the computer.

I've already asked a previous question using the Mozilla Firefox support section and verified the profile is in fact gone. No backups are available to rollback using Firefox and the backup profiles in the "Windows.old" and "Windows.old(1)" both contain saved profiles from after the reset.

It sounds like my last option is contacting Mozilla directly to verify my account information and see if they can access my profile on their cloud server?

So how does someone do that? Thanks
creator: AlatorreInWA

title: Firefox 82 Crashes on Startup in Windows 10
content:
Yesterday I updated Firefox to version 82 and now it won't start up, it seems to immediately crash. There is no error report dialog box. This is on Windows 10 with the latest patches. I tried restarting the computer, installing Firefox 82 32-bit and 64-bit versions, uninstall + reinstall, and safe mode, but none of these work. (This is on a corporate laptop so I have a limited ability to change internal system settings.) The Windows error from the event log is:

Faulting application name: firefox.exe, version: 82.0.0.7592, time stamp: 0x5f8738dd Faulting module name: ntdll.dll, version: 10.0.17763.1432, time stamp: 0x80224f6f Exception code: 0xc0000409 Fault offset: 0x00000000000a4740 Faulting process id: 0x2998 Faulting application start time: 0x01d6a816d74b6186 Faulting application path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Faulting module path: C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\ntdll.dll Report Id: 5ed88218-3f48-47be-8c6c-aa5af98c902b Faulting package full name: Faulting package-relative application ID:

I installed Firefox 81 and that works fine, but it constantly tries to updated and every time I restart it crashes again. It also seems like I can't access my saved logins/passwords in this older Firefox version because it's using a different profile. I'm trying to avoid updating Firefox on my other Windows 10 computer in case it fails in the same way.

Please let me know if you need any more information. Thank you.
creator: fgennari

title: Login com o 2FA
content: Olá Eu tenho o 2FA ativado no meu login do youtube, e sempre quando eu entro ele pede o 2FA, eu marco a caixa para lembrar do login, mas nunca lembra quando eu faço o login depois de sair. Como faço para o navegador lembrar e não pedir mais o 2FA?
creator: ksgust

title: Copy Sinc Logins/Passwords to New Account After Password Reset
content:
I use Firefox sync to share logins and passwords between my home and work computer. I set this up a few years ago. Now I want to sync another computer, but I don't remember the sync password. I believe it's written in a code book in my office, which has been closed due to Covid 19 since March. How can I change my sync password while preserving my login and password info? Many of my passwords were generated by Firefox and not something I would ever remember.

I can see my current logins and passwords on a sync enabled computer, so in theory I can copy and re-enter them all. But there are hundreds, and that would many hours. If I was willing to do this, is there a way that I can enter the logins and passwords into a table in Firefox without having to visit every website, log in, and re-save the login info? At this point my only two options seem to be to not use my sinced profile on that computer, or to spend all day manually setting everything up again. Thanks.
creator: fgennari

title: Certificate Manager > Servers > Where does Firefox see this information?
content:
Hello.

I'm not sure how this happened, but I have a listing in Servers in the Certificate Manager with the following information:

Server: www.bignox.com:443 Certificate Name: VMware Lifetime: Permanent

Trying to go anywhere with bignox.com does not work as its using the VMware certificate for some reason. If I delete it and go to the site, Firefox says the site is not trusted. I cannot get to bignox.com via any other web browser (Edge, Chrome, etc..) as I get the same type of security warnings. I do have vmware on my computer. I can connect to bignox.com just fine inside the VMware. If I uninstall the VMware, then I get security exceptions.

My question is, where does Firefox see this information? I have no idea how this happened, but I would like to get rid of this association.

Thanks
creator: fettsvett201

title: Firefox
content:
Dear Mozilla support,

I just switched to firefox and Im having an issue with youtube. When i go to a channels videos and scroll down the page and open a video, when i come back to the previous tab the page resets up to the top. I dont know if this is a scroll anchoring issue or a memory limit issue, Im not sure. Here is how i can replicate the issue every time:

1. go to youtube.com 2. select a channel. 3. go to videos on the channel. 4.sort videos by date (oldest). 5. scroll down a lot and open a random video in a new tab. 6. watch video in full screen for 1 minute. 7. stop video and go back to the first tab. 8. first tab has now reset to the top.

I'm on firefox version 82.0 (64-bit) and i only have ublock origin extension installed. I do not experience this issue with chrome. Please advice.

Thank you.

title: Weird problem:  'Search in page' (CTRL+F) orks fine on most pages but is not working on one particular page
content:
The page search facility (Ctrl+F) works fine for most pages, but doesn't work on one particular page.

The page in question happens to be my home page and is one that I created via Macromedia Dreamweaver. It is my web portal containing numerous links (to all the sites I usually access).

I press Ctrl+F and the search box appears at bottom of screen, as usual. I enter a word in the search box, click the up and down arrows, but it doesn't find any matches, even though that word definitely exists on the page (multiple times). (The Highlight All, Match Case, Whole Words options are not selected). If I enable "Highlight All", nothing is highlighted.

This problem has surfaced in the last month or so. I suspect it may have crept in with a recent Firefox update, as this wasn't a problem in the past. My setup: Desktop PC, Win 10 (64bit), Firefox is 82.0 (64-bit) -the current version, and I'm using the Default Theme.

PS: I opened the same page with Microsoft Edge and the Page Search works fine there. .... but Firefox is my preferred browser, so I need to get to the bottom of this problem.

Any suggestions on how I can resolve this weird problem?

title: Lockwise and multiple usernames
content:
I subscribe to a number of separate "Things" hosted by a single company (silly example) http://stuffstuff.co.uk. My user name for each of the separate things is "mr-silly@silly.co.uk" and the only thing that differentiates them is that each "Thing" requires a different password.

Thing 1 Username: mr-silly@silly.co.uk Password: 1sillything Thing 2 Username: mr-silly@silly.co.uk Password: 2anothersillything Thing 3 Username: mr-silly@silly.co.uk Password: 3moresillything

and so on...

Unfortunately this Lockwise thing will not permit this to happen, presenting the following stupid message.

"An entry for http://stuffstuff.co.uk with that username already exists. Go to existing entry?"

How do I get around this Lockwise silliness?

The email address is required as the user name by the company.

Don't suggest having a different email address for each user name, that is not possible.

While the question maybe posed in a silly manner  :-) I am quite serious about the problem. Thanks Ax

title: Problem with Firefox v82.0 64bit and LastPass
content:

I don't have this problem with other browsers like Edge, but its too late for me now.

content:

I tried declaring A4 paper size from about:config page but that did not solve the issue. This does not happen if I use any other browser. I could really use some help as I use Firefox for my business and it is really troublesome to take so much time for a simple print, not to mention the mistakes in printed Invoices due to the fact that we always have to remember to change the settings before every single print!

Thank you in advance, Nikos

title: Iframe doesn't render a local page when src is local and redirected to remote then back to local
content:
Hi and sorry for the vague subject line.

Here is the situation. On one page of the site an iframe is rendered. The src element of the iframe is a local url. The src url will render an html page which is simply an html form that posts to a remote url. The remote site will do some internal posts and then finally sends a get request back to my app. The final step is to render a local page from my app. All that should happen within the iframe.

With Firefox the final page is not rendered. I can debug the site and I see the final get request is processed on the server but Firefox doesn't display the page. I've tried returning a redirect to the final page instead of returning the html and then I can see in the dev tools a get request to that (local) url however I just get a blank page in the iframe.

All this is using https urls. Any suggestions are appreciated.

Thanks. Sean
creator: sean46

title: Restore Previous Session Tabs is missing
content:
I had like over 100 tabs lol but I had a Windows Update. My laptop froze while I had Firefox open. After the laptop restarted, I realized the new patches didn't get applied before Windows started up again, so after Windows started back up, (I did not open Firefox at all during this cycle) I went to Windows Update and hit Restart to apply the updates. After the updates got patched in and Windows restarted, I went to open Firefox and it just opens the home page.

I do have Restore Previous Session upon Startup checkmarked.

Tried restoring from the 3 line Menu button but the Restore option is not there.

Did try under History in the Menu bar but my Recently Closed Windows and Recently Closed Tabs are greyed out.

Tried the Library icon's Recently Closed Windows and Recently Closed Tabs within History and they both show up as (Empty)

Went to my Profile's folder into the sessionstore-backups folder and there's only 2 small 44kb files there both that were created when I started Firefox up: recovery.baklz4 and recovery.jsonlz4 ... the sessionstore-backups folder itself was also created when I started up Firefox after my Windows Update.

I read thru stuff like https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1204253 I do not have any files that have previous.jsonlz4 or upgrade.jsonlz4 like mentioned in my sessionstore-backups folder... not sure if they may be somewhere else like in 1 of the Temp folders somewhere else in Windows folder.

If I uninstall last Windows Updates, would it revert my Firefox Profiles folder to what it previous was or does Uninstalling last Windows Updates have no effect on the Firefox folder?
creator: xstrawberryx

title: Nach dem Update auf FIREFOX 82.0 Firefox Release October 20, 2020 funktioniert nichts mehr
content:
Nach dem Update auf FIREFOX 82.0 Firefox Release October 20, 2020 funktioniert nichts mehr. Deinstallation und Neuinstallation und Bereinigen, alles bringt keine Problemlösung. Einstellungen lassen sich nicht ändern und aktivieren. Absturzbericht lässt sich nicht öffnen. Die gleichen Probleme hatte ich vor einer Woche. Erst nach vielen Stunden Fehlerbeseitigung und unzählige Versuche mit Deinstallation und Neuinstallation und Bereinigen hatte ich für eine Woche ein zuverlässiges und fehlerfreies Arbeiten mit dem Browser Firefox. Jetzt nach dem neuen Update auf 82.0 wieder die gleichen Fehler. Der Browser FIREFOX ist unbrauchbar. Über EDGE von MICROSOFT und GOOGLE CHROME kann ich problemlos im Internet navigieren und arbeiten. Dort läuft alles fehlerfrei mit der 64-Bit-Version.

Vor einer Woche hatte ich versucht, MOZILLA bzw. die Community über diese Fehler zu kontaktieren. Ich habe keine Antwort erhalten.

Ich hoffe, dass diese erneute Fehlermeldung jetzt dazu führt, dass ich eine Antwort erhalte, wie dieses Problem gelöst werden kann.

Vielen Dank.

After updating to FIREFOX 82.0 Firefox Release October 20, 2020 nothing works anymore. Uninstalling and reinstalling and cleaning up, nothing brings a solution to the problem. Settings cannot be changed or activated. Crash report cannot be opened. I had the same problems a week ago. Only after many hours of troubleshooting and countless attempts with deinstallation and reinstallation and cleaning did I have reliable and error-free work with the Firefox browser for a week. Now after the new update to 82.0 the same errors again. The FIREFOX browser is unusable. With EDGE from MICROSOFT and GOOGLE CHROME I can easily navigate and work in the Internet. Everything there runs flawlessly with the 64-bit version.

A week ago I tried to contact MOZILLA or the community about these errors. I did not get an answer.

I hope that this repeated error message now leads to an answer on how to solve this problem.

Many Thanks.
creator: udo14

The specific link isn't the problem- all of my Google Calendar event links open when I click on them in the regular Firefox browser, and they also work when I click on them in the Microsoft Edge web app mode. I tried restarting my browser with add-ons disabled and the problem still occurred. Appreciate any help.
